title: Priyabrata Saha
text:
Priyabrata Saha


I am a researcher working at the intersection of AI/ML, scientific computing, and robotics. My work focuses on building intelligent and adaptive systems that integrate sensing, prediction, and control for dynamic physical environments.

        Ocean Acoustic Tomography
        Highly complex ocean dynamics poses several challenges in underwater acoustics. One such challenge is to reconstruct the spatiotemporal variation of ocean sound speed profile (SSP) from acoustic observations between source-receiver pairs. This problem can be formulated as a parameter inversion problem related to a dynamic forward model and is generally solved using linearized inversion of a ray-based model. We investigated the applicability of ML methods for this ocean acoustic tomography (OAT) problem. Two major challenges we faced for data-driven learning are limited empirical data and on-stationarity of SSP evolution. I approached these challenges by generating synthetic data utilizing prior knowledge of the SSP structure.
